title: Public Dataset Access and Usage
description: A. SUMMARY This dataset is used to report on public dataset access and usage within the open data portal. Each row sums the amount of users who access a dataset each day, grouped by access type (API Read, Download, Page View, etc). B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED This dataset is created by joining two internal analytics datasets generated by the SF Open Data Portal. We remove non-public information during the process. C. UPDATE PROCESS This dataset is scheduled to update every 7 days via ETL. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET This dataset can help you identify stale datasets, highlight the most popular datasets and calculate other metrics around the performance and usage in the open data portal. Please note a special call-out for two fields: - "derived": This field shows if an asset is an original source (derived = "False") or if it is made from another asset though filtering (derived = "True"). Essentially, if it is derived from another source or not. - "provenance": This field shows if an asset is "official" (created by someone in the city of San Francisco) or "community" (created by a member of the community, not official). All community assets are derived as members of the community cannot add data to the open data portal.

columns.name: access_count
columns.description: sum of interactions with the dataset

columns.name: access_type
columns.description: API Call, Download, Page view, etc

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: when the data was loaded into socrata

whom_it_may_interest: Data Analysts, City Officials, Dataset Curators, Open Data Advocates, and Researchers interested in public dataset engagement and usage trends.

queries.Monthly: SELECT access_type, asset_type, department, derived, provenance, date_trunc_ym(event_time) AS month, SUM(cast(access_count as integer)) AS total_access_count WHERE event_time >= start_date GROUP BY month, access_type, asset_type, department, derived, provenance ORDER BY month
queries.Yearly: SELECT access_type, asset_type, department, derived, provenance, date_trunc_y(event_time) AS year, SUM(cast(access_count as integer)) AS total_access_count WHERE event_time >= start_date GROUP BY year, access_type, asset_type, department, derived, provenance ORDER BY year
